intro: Pycreus nitens f. gracilis, commonly known as the slender pycreus, is a rare and delicate plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded woodland areas. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in its native range.
